result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca E Guden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Jail sentence can be served in Wood County if they allow it. 
Huber if employed, for employment or any counseling she is involved in.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact, direct/indirect, with Patrick Helton or be on premises where he resides, is employed or is temporarily occupying.

Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Probation can be transferred to Wood County.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca E Guden in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:58 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  Victim is present.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the victim. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Imposed & Stayed - 200 days jail
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Jail sentence can be served in Wood County if they allow it. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Serve 5 days jail. 
Huber if employed, for employment or any counseling she is involved in. 
No contact, direct/indirect, with Patrick Helton or be on premises where he resides, is employed or is temporarily occupying. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Probation can be transferred to Wood County.
No contact with Patrick Helton, his residence or his place of employment.

Defendant Rebecca E Guden in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Rebecca E Guden
Current: 6264 Hwy 186, Vesper, WI 54489 United States  (Effective: 06-25-2015)
Prior: 1813 1st Street South, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Rebecca E Guden in court. Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reschedules.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
